quote: Captain's Log: Stardate 44932.3   The Enterprise is preparing to   enter the Mar Oscura, an   unexplored dark matter nebula   first identified over a century   ago.
Commander Data is modifying   several of our photon torpedos   for an experiment designed to   elicit more information about this   unusual phenomenon.
The initial dispersal pattern   should not be more than seven   kilometers in diameter.
Six point eight kilometers...
That should suffice.       Is there something occupying your   thoughts, Jenna? You are somewhat   subdued today...
I bumped into Jeff in the   turbolift again this morning.
Was the experience as emotionally   problematic as last week's   encounter?
He... asked me to dinner.
What was your response?
I told him I'd think about it.
As you requested, I must now   remind you of the reasons you   decided to end your relationship   with Jeff.
I guess I asked for this... go   ahead.

You objected to the fact that Jeff   seemed unwilling to set aside   sufficient time for you. You said   he never did... the little things.   He was unresponsive. You disliked   the sound he made when he ate his   soup...
Okay, okay... I remember.
This is the third time I have   refreshed your memory. Do you   wish to rescind our agreement?
No, no. It's for my own good.   It's just so easy to forget.       Hand me that sequencer.
Many lovers throughout history   have had similar difficulties.   Anne Boleyn was quite distressed   that Henry the Eighth preferred   the company of his huntsmen to   that of his wife.
As I recall, she ended up losing   her head. I guess I'm well out of   this.       When did you develop an interest   in romantic historical figures?
Six weeks ago, when you and Jeff   dissolved your relationship, I   saw an excellent opportunity to   study that aspect of human   intimacy. Also, I believed it   was my obligation to do so.
"Obligation"? What do you mean?
I anticipated this would be a   difficult period for you. As your   friend, it is my responsibility   to be supportive in times of need.
That is really sweet, Data.
Data to Bridge. We are ready for   the first illumination test.
Acknowledged. All science   stations stand by... we're about   to light up the nebula. Mister   Worf?
Launch bay one shows ready,   Commander.
Fire torpedo.
It's beautiful.    (she moves closer to     him)   Like watching fireworks when I   was a little girl.
It was wonderful.
Thanks.
Is anything wrong?
My tempo was off. I felt like   I was really rushing it.
I do not believe that is so. Your   rhythmic control has improved   markedly. I heard no fluctuations   during the performance.
Well, maybe. But I ruined the   coda. I got confused with the   phrasing... I kept breathing at   the wrong times.

The contrapuntal nature of the   composition is quite demanding.   We will give the rhythmic   patterns more attention in our   next rehearsal.       However, I am quite certain that   the audience was oblivious to such   nuances. They seemed to enjoy   the performance thoroughly.
Thanks, Data... you're really   sweet.

... every night, Miles leaves his   socks on the floor. When we got   married, I made the mistake of   picking them up a few times...   then I realized if I kept it up   I'd be doing it the rest of my   life... so I stopped... figuring   he'd get the message and do it   himself.
One night goes by... two... a   week... ten days... by now there's   a pile of socks half a meter   high!
Come on... it wasn't half a   meter...
After two weeks I couldn't stand   it any more -- I bundled them up   and put them in the cleaning   processor. And I'm still doing   it.
And a very good job of it she   does, too...
Keiko, you sound just like Data.   He came to my quarters the other   day to give me a music lesson,   and he said the funniest thing...   how did you put it, Data?
I believe I observed that you seem   to have an aversion to   orderliness... but it was not   intended as a humorous remark...
So before we started, he gallantly   offered to help me straighten up.
And a very good job of it I did,   too.
Report, Mister Data.
I am nearly finished compiling   the readings from our most recent   illuminatory burst. They differ   considerably from surveys of   similar nebulae.
How so?
Dark matter density is nearly one   order of magnitude higher than   previously found.       Lifeforms here may have developed   in ways never before observed.
Interesting hypothesis. Are there   any M-Class planets we could check   out?
Several, Sir. The nearest is   approximately three light years   from our present position.
It's worth a look. We'll continue   with our survey along the way.       Ensign, get the planet's   coordinates from Commander Data   and plot a course, three quarters   impulse.
Let's increase the flow rate --   see if that helps.
Sometimes in the summer we went   on cookouts... just my little   brother and me, and Mother... She   was hopeless without a replicator.   But we didn't care.
Children often do not develop a   discerning palette until well   beyond adolescence.

It's wasn't that. It just felt...   so good to be together... as a   family. We didn't have much of   that after my father died... so   those times were really special.       I wish we were back there now...   you and I...
The unidirectional nature of the   time continuum makes that an   unlikely possibility.
That's one thing I've always loved   about you. You make me laugh.       You know, maybe I've been with   the wrong men. Why couldn't they   be like you, Data? You've got   everything.
That is not true. I have no human   feelings.

But you've still given me more   than any of them. You've spent   time with me when I was lonely...   you've encouraged me when I was   down. No one could have been   kinder to me... those are the   things that matter...
(continuing, re: the     job)   Well, I think that's it.       With your permission, Commander,   I'll be going.
Permission granted.
I don't know if you're aware of   it... but you're very handsome...
See you tomorrow...
Hi, Data. Want to try something   new?
This is a concoction I heard about   on Prakal Two. I think it's   great, but I want another opinion,   so...
Eighty-seven percent Saurian   Brandy... Targ milk and Denevian   mead comprise the rest... an   unusually high concentration of   mono-saccharides and fructose   compounds.
Too sweet, huh?
If I didn't know you better, I'd   say you were... preoccupied.
Ensign D'Sora just gave me what   could be considered a very...   passionate kiss in the Torpedo   Bay.
Really?       How did it make you feel?
I cannot feel because---
I know, I know. You have no   emotions.       What I mean is, what's going on   in there?       What did it make you think about?
I was... intrigued. Jenna seemed   to be displaying genuine affection   toward me.
And then?
I calculated that Jenna's actions   to date would tend to support the   supposition that she wishes to   initiate a non-platonic mutually   exclusive relationship.
You're just a starry-eyed   romantic, aren't you?       What do you think of her?
I find her to be a competent   officer... highly motivated...   lacking somewhat in her   understanding of the theory   underlying dilithium matrix   applications---
But what do you think of her   personally?       Do you like her?
I have become... used to her.
It sounds like the next step is   up to you.       So what are you gonna do about   it?
I do not know. Clearly, an   ongoing intimate relationship is   an option. However, I am   inexperienced in such matters.   I require advice.
Well, don't look at me.
No, no. I mean, this time I don't   have any advice to give. You   can't tell someone how to handle   their first love affair. They have   to find a way to do that   themselves.
But I am incapable of love.
Then this should be a very unique   experience.
Missing someone?
I found Spot wandering through   the corridor two sections away.
Thank you.
Forget to secure the door when   you left?
The door sensor has been   programmed to recognize only   humanoid forms for entry or   egress. Spot could not have   triggered the mechanism.
Maybe someone came in while you   were away and let him out by   accident. Has anything been   disturbed?
(looks around very     quickly)   No.       Computer, has anyone entered my   quarters in the last twelve hours   other than myself or Commander   La Forge?
Negative.
That's pretty strange... we should   report a possible unauthorized   entry to security, just to be on   the safe side.
Geordi, may I ask your advice   concerning a... personal matter?
Sure, Data.
Should I pursue a relationship   with Ensign D'Sora?
Ensign Jenna D'Sora. Serial   number CL-10928---
Yeah, I know who she is. I   thought she and Jeff Arton...
They discontinued their   association. Now she has made   the... first move in initiating   a relationship with me.       What should I do?
Hmmm... if she just ended a bad   situation... sometimes it takes   people a while... but if they   jump into another relationship   --
... see, that can be a problem...   unless, of course, she is ready...   and then it depends if you're   really serious. It's uh... kind   of complicated.
My advice to you is... to ask   someone else for advice. Someone   with a little more experience in   these things.
I think you should be careful.   This is not some experiment you're   running. Jenna is a living,   breathing person with needs and   feelings that have to be   considered.
Then you believe I should not   pursue this any further.
No, I didn't say that... I just   want you to be aware that this   will be unlike any other... more   casual relationship that you've   attempted.
I have studied a great deal of   human literature on the subject   of love and romantic liaisons.   There are many role models for   me to emulate.
Ultimately, Jenna will care for   you because of what you are. Not   what you imitate out of a book.
My programming may be inadequate   to the task.
We're all more than the sum of   our parts, Data. You'll have to   be more than the sum of your   programming.
Klingons do not... pursue   relationships. They conquer that   which they desire.
However...       Ensign D'Sora serves under my   command. If she were...   mistreated, I would be very...   displeased.
I understand.
I think you should pursue it.   First of all, she's a beautiful   woman who seems to be crazy about   you.
Jenna has clearly demonstrated   how she feels about me. But I   am not capable of returning those   feelings.
I'm sure she's aware of that.       Data, when you get involved with   another person, there's always   a risk. Of disappointment. Of   getting hurt.
I cannot get hurt. But she can.

Jenna knows that. And she's   obviously decided to take the   chance. Data, when it really   works between two people, it's   like nothing you've ever   experienced -- the rewards are   far beyond simple friendship.
How far beyond, sir?
Well, that's what I hope you're   about to find out.
Thank you, Commander.
Captain, I am seeking advice in---
Yes, I've heard, Data... and I   would be delighted to offer you   any advice I have on understanding   women.       As soon as I have some, I'll let   you know.

Second Officer's personal log,   Stardate 44935.6. After   conferring with my colleagues   regarding the nature of romantic   love in general, and my own   situation in particular, I have   reached a decision.
They're beautiful. Come in.
Mmmm. What are they?
Crystilia. Their fragrance is   an evolutionary response to the   acrid nature of the atmosphere   on Telemarius Three.
You silver-tongued devil.       Let me find somewhere to put   these.
Hmmm. That might not be so   easy...
It seems that your quarters have   reverted to their earlier state   of disorder.
I know. I'm hopeless.
There.       They're beautiful, Data. It's   so sweet of you...
It was Commander Riker who   suggested this particular flower.   He said that it had worked for   him in the past.
You didn't talk to the entire ship   about us...

No. In actuality, less than one   percent of the Enterprise crew   was involved. It was necessary   to balance theory with   experiential referents. Both are   required for a program of this   nature.       Computer, decrease illumination   level by one third standard lux.
This is all part of a program?
Yes. One which I have just   created for romantic   relationships.
So... I'm just a small variable   in one of your new computational   environments?

You are much more than that,   Jenna. I have written a   subroutine specifically for you   -- a program within the program.   I have devoted a considerable   share of my internal resources   to its development.
That's the nicest thing anyone's   ever said to me.
Estimated time of arrival, Mister   Data?
We will reach the M class planet   in approximately eleven hours.
You have the Bridge, Number One.
Picard to Lieutenant Worf.
Yes, Captain?
Step into my Ready Room, please.   And bring a tricorder.
Aye, Sir.
Captain?
What do you make of this?
I am puzzled, Sir.
So am I, Mister Worf.
Captain, the only detectable   bioelectric residuals are your   own.       You did not --
-- No. I did not.
It seems we have a poltergeist.
Sir?
A mischievous spirit.
Hoq-JoH.
Perhaps this is some kind of   practical joke.
Sir?
Perhaps not.
I cannot explain how an intruder   could have entered this room...   I recommend we go to Red Alert.
Not yet.
Then I will order one of my   officers to stand watch.       Worf to Ensign --
-- That's alright, Mister Worf.   For now, I think circumstances   warrant our caution -- nothing   more.
As you wish, Captain.
Enter.
I know it's a little unexpected...
You are correct. I did not   anticipate your arrival until   nineteen hundred hours.
I couldn't wait... I wanted you   to have this.
You have often expressed   dissatisfaction with the Spartan   nature of my quarters. Is this   an attempt at embellishment?
The cat's out of the bag.
Spot?
I mean you've caught me in the   act. I'm just trying to brighten   things up around here.       It's Tyrinean. What do you think?
Its line is both fluid and formal,   yet retains an unpremeditated   quality. The tactility of the   surface enrichment is evocative   of the neo-primitive period in   Tyrinean blade carving.
I hadn't thought of it that way.
I'm sorry. Don't let me   interrupt.
Alright.
Data.
Yes?
The Book of Love, chapter four,   paragraph seventeen: When your   girlfriend arrives with a gift,   stop whatever it is you're doing,   and give her your undivided   attention.
My literature search was   apparently incomplete. I   discovered twenty-nine books with   that title, but none contained   that particular admonition.
That's because we're writing our   own version as we go -- you and   I.
I should not have resumed my   painting?
No.
Despite your suggestion that I   continue?
Exactly.
The nature of our interactions   is considerably more subtle and   complex than I had anticipated.   I have much to learn.
Let's start with this.
A critical analysis isn't   necessarily the best response to   a gift.
Perhaps if I looked for a suitable   place to display it.
Much better.
The ambient light in this location   accentuates its contours.
However, a gift should not   necessarily be placed according   to aesthetic criteria. A more   central location will carry added   meaning.
Data, what's important is that   you're trying. You don't know   how much that means to me.
Now, go back to your painting.
This time I really mean it.       I'll see you tonight.
Riker to Captain Picard. You're   needed on the Bridge.
Acknowledged.
We've reached the designated   coordinates.
But the M-Class planet... it's   gone.
Are you sure there was no   malfunction in the sensors?
No, sir. Lateral EM scanners   registered radiation indicative   of an M-Class planet.
Sir!
Mister Data, run a complete   systems diagnostic --
-- Atmospheric decompression in   Bridge Observation Lounge...   Environmental compensation   sequence has been initiated...
I am not registering a hull   breach.
Scan for lifeforms.
None, Sir.
Computer, boost the structural   integrity field around the hull   by one hundred percent.
Field augmented...
Captain. Standard air pressure   has been reestablished in the   Observation lounge.
Let's have a look.
Captain.
I do not understand.
Data, are you picking up anything?
I detect no unusual readings.
Curious. The transparent aluminum   alloy of this window is   exhibiting a pattern of transient   electrical currents.
Explanation?
I have none. The rate is   characteristic of a subspace   distortion. But I am not picking   up evidence of subspace fields.
We will hold position while we   seek an explanation for these   anomalies. Divert all resources   to that end.
Hi, honey, I am home.
Hi.
Any luck at your end?
Negative. We performed a full   systems diagnostic and found no   malfunctions.
We did a full security sweep.   Nothing.
Can I get you a drink, dear?
Well, yes. I think I'll have...   a Calaman Sherry.
Excellent choice. I shall join   you.
Two Calaman Sherries.       Would you like some dinner as   well?
I'm too tired to think about what   I want... maybe later.
Whatever you like, dear.
Darling, you remain as   aesthetically pleasing as the day   we first met. I believe I am the   most fortunate sentient in this   sector of the galaxy.
Now... you must relax. Put your   feet up. I will take care of   everything.
I could organize your closets.   I have found that by grouping   apparel first by function, and   then by color from light to dark,   one can more easily locate one's   desired choice.
Data... it's all right. You don't   have to do that...
But I am happy to do it.
Please... put them down.
What would you like, dear? Am   I not paying enough attention to   you?
It's not that...
Perhaps I have not given you   enough compliments. Your hair   is looking particularly silky   tonight...
Data... there's just something...   strange... about the way you're   acting...
Am I not behaving as a solicitous   mate?
Well, yes, but...
Tending to your every need?
What is wrong with you tonight?
My most recent self-diagnostic   revealed no malfunctions. Perhaps   something is wrong with you.
I've never seen you behave so...   foolishly. Why are you doing   this?
You may not tell me how I should   behave. You are not my mother.
What?
"You are not my mother." Is that   not an appropriate response to   your statement that I am behaving   foolishly?
Data, I think you should just   leave.
You do not wish to continue our...   lovers quarrel?
Is that what this is?
In my study of interpersonal   dynamics, I learned that conflict   followed by emotional release   often strengthens a connection   between two people.
But there's just something   forced and artificial about the   way you're doing it. It's not   the real you.
With respect to romantic   relationships, there is no... real   me. I am drawing upon various   literary and cultural sources to   help define my role.
Kiss me.
What were you just thinking?

At that particular moment, I was   reconfiguring the warp field   parameters, analyzing the   collected works of Charles   Dickens, calculating the maximum   pressure I could safely apply to   your lips, considering a new food   supplement for Spot...
I'm glad I was in there somewhere.
A complete sensor scan of the   planet and three survey probes   turned up no surprises. No sign   of life, nothing out of the   ordinary.
A complete sensor scan of the   planet and three survey probes   turned up no surprises. No sign   of life, nothing out of the   ordinary.
Seven more unusual incidents have   been reported. No casualties or   damage.

At present, we can only state that   a subspace effect seems to exist   within this nebula. After I have   made further analysis, I may be   able to adjust the ship's sensors   to locate and identify the   anomaly.
The ship is at risk as long as   we're sitting here. We can always   continue our investigation from   outside the nebula.
Agreed. Ensign McKnight, plot the   most direct course. Ahead warp   one.
Yes, Sir.
Engage...
Captain.
Captain! Explosive decompression   on Deck Thirty-seven!
Bridge to La Forge... damage   report.
We're showing damage between decks   -- we haven't localized it yet.
Thorne!
La Forge to Bridge... a cryogenic   control conduit just blew out on   us. I almost lost a man...
Full stop!
Yes, Sir --
La Forge to Bridge...
Yes, Commander?
I think we have some structural   damage between Decks Thirty-Six   and Seven. We're checking it out   now.
Van Mayter, you take access tube   twenty-three M and look at the   the Bridge connectors.
I'll cover the aft section. You   go---
During the series of events, I   was able to measure the W particle   inference which confirms one of   my hypotheses.
The unusual preponderance of dark   matter in this nebula is causing   small gaps in the fabric of normal   space.
As the Enterprise moves through   the nebula, it collides with these   deformations.
Like a carriage bouncing over a   series of potholes.
That is an apt analogy.
So every time we hit one, part   of the ship momentarily phases   out of normal space.
Or when one of them hits us. My   readings suggest that the   deformations themselves are in   motion.
We're lucky one of these pockets   didn't pass through a photon   torpedo casing... or the   matter/anti-matter containment   pods.
The question now is, how do we   get out? Mister Data, can you   reconfigure the sensors to detect   these anomalies?
Yes, sir, but they can only be   perceived at extremely close   range. Even at minimal speed,   it would be impossible to maneuver   the Enterprise quickly enough to   avoid them.
A shuttlecraft is more   maneuverable...
He's right.
If we positioned a shuttle far   enough in front of the   Enterprise... it could detect the   pockets and provide us enough   time to maneuver out of the way.
We could give the shuttle control   of our navigational systems --   that way, the corresponding   maneuvers would be virtually   instantaneous.
Make it so.
You are relieved, Ensign.
I'll do my pre-flight once I'm   on board.
Not this time, Will.
Sir?
I'm going to pilot the shuttle.
Captain... my duty as First   Officer is to safeguard the lives   on this ship. Including yours.   The Enterprise can't afford to   lose you, sir. Not in this   situation.
I believe our best chance of   escaping this situation is for   me to pilot that shuttle.       This is my ship, Will. I've   got to do it.
Captain.
Shuttle three to Enterprise,   telementry link enabled.
Ship's computer is accepting   navigational inputs from the   shuttle.
Forward sensors are on line.   Ensign McKnight, plot a course   for the shortest distance out of   the nebula.
Plot laid in, sir. Outer   perimeter at thirty-two million   kilometers.
Point one impulse, Number One.
Acknowledged, Captain. We're   right behind you.       Riker to O'Brien, lock on to the   Captain's communicator. I want   to be able to pull him out of   there if I have to.
Aye, sir.
Changing course... new heading   two-nine-nine mark zero-two-nine.
Main coupling is matching   navigational inputs, Captain.
New heading confirmed.
I missed it by less than a   thousand meters, Enterprise...   Advise your status...
Sensors indicate the deformation   passing five hundred meters off   the starboard bow. We're   clear...
One down, Captain...
Resuming previous course.
Confirmed. Outer perimeter now   at thirty-point-one million   kilometers.
Changing course... heading zero   seven three, mark --   two-eight-eight...
New heading... two-eight-four   mark zero...
Enterprise... I'm losing   maneuverability...
Sensors indicate damage to the   shuttle's starboard impulse   nacelle, Captain.
I'm reading fluctuations in the   thermal control sub-system...
Captain, I'm bringing you back.
Belay that, Number One! I'm   re-routing the secondary deuterium   supply... switching to manual   controls.
Transceiver signal is down   forty-two percent. Navigational   inputs are not registering.
Captain, we've lost the link.
You'll have to make course changes   manually until we re-establish   the connection.

Understood. Get us back on line,   Data. Geordi, try boosting the   power to the L-U band. And   increase the distance between the   Enterprise and the shuttle. We're   going to need some more room to   make manual adjustments.
Aye, sir.
How far do we have to go?
Sixteen million kilometers.
New heading... two-nine-nine mark   one eight...
Yes, sir... I've got it... course   corrected.
Enterprise -- hard starboard!
Aye, sir --
Deformation impact on Deck   Fifteen... science section...
Damage?
Report coming in, sir... minimal   damage.
Hold steady... I've completed the   re-routing sequence... do you read   my navigational inputs?
Data, do we have the telemetry   link back?
I have increased sensitivity in   the L-U band... it should be   sufficient.
Captain, let's try it.
New heading. Two-seven-five mark   three nine!
Confirmed... the link has been   re-established.
Nine-point-four million kilometers   to the perimeter.
Mister La Forge, I am still having   difficulty controlling the   shuttlecraft.
Yes, sir, your krellide storage   cells are losing their charge.   Maintaining manual control is   gonna get increasingly harder...
Estimated distance to the nebula's   perimeter?
Four-point-seven million   kilometers, sir.
Is there a way to transfer the   microfusion thrusters so I can   get a power boost?
Possibly. If you augment the   thruster sequencing so that the   inertial dampening fields --
Bearing -- two-seven... make that   two-eight-five, mark   two-five-five!
Commander, the shuttle is out of   control. Navigational link is   severed.
Mister O'Brien -- do you have the   Captain's signal?
I'm having trouble locking on,   sir.
Sir, the shuttle's inertial   dampeners have failed. It is   breaking up.
Now would be a good time, Mister   O'Brien...
O'Brien -- did we get him?
Aye, sir, we got him.
I'm a little dizzy, Number One...   but none the worse... on my way...
Acknowledged, sir.
Commander, we are nearing the   perimeter -- one million   kilometers away.
All right, let's make a run for   it.
We're clear of the nebula, sir.
Ensign, plot a course for Starbase   Two-Sixty. Warp two. Engage.
Enter.
Hello.
Hi.
The place looks great.
Thank you. It is much less   Spartan, is it not?
Much less... It looks... great...   it really does... it looks great.
Jenna, you are repeating yourself.   I have found this to be indicative   of mental distraction. Is that   a correct assumption in this   instance?
I'm afraid it is.
Then perhaps we should begin our   meal. Among humans, a low serum   glucose level is often responsible   for --
-- Data.
Let's talk... first.
I'm not sure how to begin.
What is the subject?
You and me. Our relationship.
Yes?
Data, sometimes people blindly   make the same mistake again and   again. Until it finally happens   in a way so obvious and so   blatant, that they can no longer   deny what they've been doing.
Are you currently experiencing   this phenomenon?
I didn't see it until today. I   got out of a relationship with   an unemotional man. And went   right back into another with a   man who is absolutely incapable   of emotion.
There does appear to be a   recurring motif.
You were so kind and attentive.   I thought maybe that would be   enough.
It is not?
No, it's not. Because as close   as we are, I don't really matter   to you. Not really. Nothing I   could do or say will ever make   you happy, or hurt you, or touch   you in any way.
That is... a valid projection.
It is apparent that my reach has   exceeded my grasp in this   particular area. I am perhaps   not nearly so human as I aspire   to become...
If you are ready to eat, I will   bring our meal.
No. That's alright.
I'd better go, Data.
If you wish.
Jenna. Are we no longer... a   couple?
No... we're not.
Then I will delete the   appropriate program.
(quickly toward the     door)   I'll see you later...
Hello, Spot.
